edus.text: so first of all we what we did is we conducted an experiment with hundred test subjects .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: we put them in our usability laboratory and got them to , play with remote controls , and also to complete , after they'd done that , to complete questionnaire to tell us what they like and what they don't like in remote controls .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: so the major things we found out was that users don't like the look and feel of most remote controls that are currently on the market .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: they , seventy five percent of the people we did the experiments on , found that rem remote the remote controls that they'd used in the past were ugly .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: they didn't match the operating behaviour of the user , that is , the way users use remote controls when they're watching t_v_ .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: that the layout of the remote controls didn't match they way that they used it .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: and thirdly they say that half of the users that we tested said that they only used ten percent of the buttons that are on remote controls .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: so we collect we also some collected some usage statistics based on how these test subjects were using their remote control .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: and from this we came up with the figure that the channel buttons , the channel selection buttons are the most by far the most used buttons on the remote control .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: and you can see they're used hundred and sixty eight times per hour on average , while the user's watching t_v_ .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: the closest button that was used , the cl the button that was used that was closest to the channel button was the teletext button , which was used fourteen times per hour , followed by the volume button , which was four times per hour , all the other , all the other buttons , such as ch audio and picture selection configuration buttons and things were used , approx less than or equal to one times per hour .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: we also asked users which buttons had the most importance to them , which buttons they felt were the most important buttons on the remote control .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: and they came they said the channel , volume , and power buttons had the highest relevance to users , note that only power was very infrequently used , it only had fr usage frequency of about one times per hour , but users ranked it as having very high relevance .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: and the audio and picture settings had very that the users thought that the audio and picture settings were very weren't very important to them , and they used them very infrequently as .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: so we asked users what frustrates them the most about current remote controls .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: and fifty percent of the users said that what frustrates them is losing the remote control somewhere in the room and not being able to find it .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: they also said that it takes lot of time to learn new remote control , especially when there's many buttons and it's , unintuitive interface .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: and then thirdly , they some users commented on the fact that the way that you have to hold and press buttons on remote control ar are bad and repetitive strain injury .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: we also asked some users about some specific features that they'd like to see in the on the remote control .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: in particular , do they want an display , and secondly , do they think speech recognition is useful feature to have on remote control .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: our findings are that amongst younger age groups the answer is umv overwhelmingly yes .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: they want these features , they want these high technology features .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: ninety one percent of pe of people aged between fifteen and twenty five said yes , they want these features .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: whereas the trend was as users became older and older they were less likely to want these features in remote control .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: so it depends on where we're focusing our market .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: and as our company motto is putting fashion in electronics , we're focusing on the younger target demographic , and so we should think about adding these high technology features into our remote control .
edus.speaker: D

edus.text: that's my dic that's my presentation .
